tool.name: FROGS Phyloseq Composition Visualization
tool.description: with bar plot and composition plot

param.name: data
param.label: Phyloseq object (format rdata)
param.help: This is the result of FROGS Phyloseq Import Data.

param.name: varExp
param.label: Grouping variable
param.help: Experimental variable used to group samples (Treatment, Host type, etc).

param.name: taxaRank1
param.label: Taxonomic rank at which to filter your data
param.help: ex: Kingdom, Phylum, Class, Order, Family, Genus, Species

param.name: taxaSet1
param.label: Taxa (at previously specified taxonomic rank) to keep in the dataset
param.help: ex: Bacteria (when filtering at Kingdom level), Firmicutes (when filtering at Phylum level). Multiple taxa (separated by a white space) can be specified: Firmicutes Proteobacteria

param.name: taxaRank2
param.label: Taxonomic rank used for aggregation
param.help: ex: Family (when filtering at the Phylum level). The aggregation rank must be below the filtering rank.

param.name: numberOfTaxa
param.label: Number of most abundant taxa to keep
param.help: ex: 9. Remaining taxa will be aggregated in a 'Other' group

tool.help:
.. image:: ${static_path}/images/tools/frogs/FROGS_logo.png :height: 144 :width: 110
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
What it does
Using `phyloseq <https://joey711.github.io/phyloseq/>`_ and custom R function, this tool constructs two plots to visualize sample composition: one at the OTU level and another one at the aggregation level specified (e.g. Phylum) after keeping only a subset of taxa (e.g. Bacteria at the level Kingdom). It helps answer the question: "What is the composition at the Phylum level within Bacteria?". By default, the plot only exhibits the abundance of the 9 most abundant taxa. In general, representing more than 10 taxa leads to hard to read plots.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Inputs/Outputs
.. class:: h3
Input
**data file** (format rdata): The informations of data in one phyloseq object. These file is the result of FROGS Phyloseq Import Data.
.. class:: h3
Output
**html file** (format `HTML <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML>`_): data composition plots.
Bar plot of OTUs colored with aggregated taxonomic rank : "Phylum" :
.. image:: ${static_path}/images/tools/frogs/phyloseq_bar_plot.png :height: 646 :width: 800
Composition plot: plot the most abundant sub taxonomic rank among a selection of OTUs.
- Selectionf of OTUs:
- Taxonomic rank name to subset: Kingdom - Taxon name: Bacteria
- Aggregation of OTUs :
- Taxonomic rank used to agglomerate: Phylum
- Number of the most abundant taxa to keep: 5
